column4: Hey guys. I'm switching from Ubuntu to Windows on my computer, but I have about 26gb of data that I need to transfer to my Windows Vista laptop before I can do so. Networking is broken on said Ubuntu computer, so how would I go about doing this?
Wow Dravekx_
you can't tell but I'm cracking up right now at that joke
hold on
I'm writing it down for later use
I only have one partition.
what network card do you have?
are you transferring from PC -> PC ?
I have a LAN/WLAN one. Don't know the name.
if you can get ubuntu connected via cat5, you can use rsync
cat5 == ethernet
you tried connecting directly?
never tried it, but a guess is that you probably used the wrong type
Wrong type of cable?
there are two types of Ethernet
there are cat5 patch cables, used for connecting to a network device (ie: hubs/switches/routers)
then there are crossover cables, used to connect two machines together
the only difference between them is how the wires at each end are aligned as
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethernet_crossover_cable
Ahh, I see.
once you have connected them, check the IP address of the network card
The problem is that my Ubuntu computer has messed up network settings.
